It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Military order] 1812 Dec. 30 [to] Quarter Master of 1st Regiment of Tennessee Volunteers / James Henderson
bibl.author: Henderson, James
bibl.note: This is a legal document written on December 30, 1812 by James Henderson, the Brigade Quarter Master, to the Quarter Master of the 1st Regiment of Tennessee Volunteers. He orders the Regiment to furnish as many wagons as needed to transport the baggage of the Regiment to the site of their next encampment from their present encampment.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p: The Quarter Master of the 1st Regiment Tennessee Volunteers is required to furnish as many waggons wagons as will transport the baggage of said Regt. Regiment from the present encampment to the place laid out this day for their next encampment. The waggons wagons to be in the present encampment at 9 OClock A. M. 31st Inst. Instant read to receive the tents and other camp equippage equipage at 10 OClock as the troops will March at 12 OClock
div.closer:
Jas. James Henderson
Brigade Quarter Master Camp Near Nashville
